In short, with decisions that you unlock upon starting a DM campaign, you decide who you will move, and towards where. You can choose between primary, accepted, or non accepted cultures moving to state or colonial provinces. Exact emigration location (from where they will go) is decided by §GProvince Selector§!, and its target is decided by §GImmigrator Selectors§! (to where they are going). Decisions have been redone to more clearly explain what are you currently doing, and what you will be doing upon changing focus. Beware, maximum of province selectors is now §RFIVE§!. An option to move non-state religion population has also been added. When you decide to stop direct migration, enact migration options decision and choose to end the campaign. Next time you wish to start it, merely re-enact the decision. If you accidentally build an immigrator where you did not wish to, or you wish to change it to another location, simply choose the option to clear all immigrators.

There is a random province event chain (National Assimilation) that enables the player or AI to initiate assimilation of populations that would otherwise be protected by culture cores. Essentially, the over-protective culture core effect is removed, and if your other modifiers allow, you will be able to gradually assimilate the current non-accepted populace. This allows the player to target a specific state, rather than a random one, with a brief campaign, without having to wait for all of the modifiers to play out in the original event chain.
